title: I think Venom is a good aproximation of what we originally expected with Kai'sa

replies.body:
"But then she'd be ugly!"
/s

> [{quoted}](name=AbrahamBaconham,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=qeA0Fk7M,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-04-25T21:44:09.612+0000)
>
> "But then she'd be ugly!"
> /s

venom is sexy ..
Ugly is the new sexy

Riot seriously should have taken a LOT of notes from Venom as a whole. Considering the fact that Venom is THE PERFECT EXAMPLE of what Riot should have done with Kai'Sa (in terms of the symbiotic parasite still having it's own agenda/thoughts/feelings/basically everything while still being attached to Kai'Sa)

Except that the symbiote that bonded with Kaisa isn't an alien giga-putty that can morph into any shape. or hide under plain sight. It doesn't even talk to her. It just stuck to her after its death and lived on her ever since. She had to keep it fed because she wasn't sure if it would turn on her.

Well thats the point though.

All these things you mention are things that riot decided to do with her character and they could have just as well decided otherwise.

The suit being mindless isn't because riot had no other choice,it is mindless(or at least seems to be) because riot decided to make it that way,when they could have easily done it differently.

“We didn’t like how Riot did their parasite, we want them to do it the way we have always seen it in the movies!!!”

Seriously, I don’t understand why everyone’s so out to impose their view on Kai’Sa. If anything, Kai’Sa is more true to real life parasitism. Parasitism doesn't magically make the host turn into some sort of monster.

Okay, but consider this. "It's the VOID." I'm also pretty sure most parasites don't come in the form of purple clothes. Real life doesn't really apply to League. What's next? Rhaast can't talk anymore because scythes can't speak?
Does everything from the void need to be exaggerated? Plus she didn’t even stay *in* the void.

First of all, exaggeration really helps in terms of character. Kled wouldn't be the same person if he wasn't, and it allows you to quickly grasp a character. Secondly, neither has Malzahar, and that dude has a third eye growing. Same with one of the Marai in that Nami comic.

To be precise,the suit and Venom are symbiontes,not parasites(as in they help the host in exchange for living off on them),parasites only hurt their hosts,with no positive effect.

And people expected Kai'sa to be monstrous,because she is a voidchamp(who are always either monstrous,insane or mutated) and the initial reveal made it sound like she was inside the void(as opposed to just a cave with void monsters) and back then the void was known for its corrupting and mutating nature(just look at the rift herald,that thing used to be a regular scuttlecrab),so Kai'sa being uncorrupted after all these years in a voidcave just comes off as an asspull to justify making her sexy.

In general I'm not a big fan of her design,I do agree that she looks kinda generic.
However I also think that at this point people are just beating a dead horse.

But why tho? With this argumentation Riot could be possibly changed MANY things.

And tbh we have already Kayn for this particular thing.

Well that is up to personal opinion.

Some people think that it would have been more interesting if Kai'sa could talk with the symbiont,some would disagree with that,really there is no right or wrong with that.

However one of the biggest complains about Kai'sa(besides the "she doesn't look monstrous enough-thing) is that the suit feels artificial and not like a living being.
Giving the suit the ability to talk(or at least communicate with grunts/screeches,which would have differentiated her a bit more from Kayn) would have made the suit feel more alive and thus fixed at least one of the biggest complains about her,even if it might have felt a bit repetetive.

Complain of who? I personally complain about nothing. She is one of the only champs which i am fine at release. 

I remember the time when Kindred and Bard got released... about them I would still complain but about Kaisa? Rlly? 
I guess just wait next new champ and there will be again someone who complains. lol
I said "some of the biggest complains",so I was obviously talking about the people who complain about Kai'sas design,not about you specifically.

I think that's a standard writing strategy, to try and distinguish yourself from similar works by taking every interesting aspect of the character and removing it to become as dull as possible.

/s

Honestly, i have a very strong feeling that none of the people who are still talking about Kai'Sa even read her lore or accompanied lore from the Void, Kassadin and Malzahar. Or even her short comic. Because this is still a dumb debate about how people cannot even grasp a simple concept of a symbiote.

Eddie Brock's and Venom's relationship can be defined as possession.
Riot explained this multiple times already but Kayn is a character that's relatively close to this thematic because one personality wins in the end. It's either Kayn or Rhaast. His gameplay revolves around this fact of a transformation into one or the other. These two even talk to each other and others.

Why would Riot make a very similar character in thematic, except from a different faction/place? They explicitly said they wanted a human that's related to the Void, not corrupted by it.

Think of Kai'Sa's symbiote as Stark's Iron Man suit.
While Stark controls his, Kai'Sa doesn't control hers. It gives her control of its Void powers because Kai'Sa does what's needed to do with them and as long as it's kept sated, she gets to do what she wants. The question is what happens when she stops indulging the creature?

I'd call it more akin to League's own "Iron Man" suit, given its similar function.
Except that for one, Kai'Sa doesn't control it one bit and that she's more or less forced to feed it in order to keep it under control.

MMMHMMM And Kai'Sa's "suit" is SHOWN to have it's own arsenal of weapons that evolved specifically to being more efficient at killing other Voidborn HOW?

The suit isn't shown to have ANY form of intelligence. NONE. ZERO. ZILCH

Whenever you keep bringing up "The suit is like Iron man's because she puts it on and it lets her have super powers" that would only work if THE SUIT ACTUALLY SHOWED THAT IT IS ALIVE SOMEHOW

"She's more or less forced to feed it in order to keep it under control"

So why isn't this shown somehow?

Kai'Sa's comics+stories never SHOW the suit feeding on anything; the comics + stories TELL US that the suit is feeding/fed on stuff that she kills

That proves nothing. I can write a story that SAYS there was a cool adventure, but unless anyone actually SEES what happened during the adventure then the book is awful

"Show don't tell" is one of the most important aspects of writing a story. Kai'Sa does the exact OPPOSITE of showing us that she's lived in a horrible place known as the void. Kai'Sa doesn't show that her suit is alive(other than some glowing BUT THERE'S ITEMS IN RUNETERRA THAT ARE GLOWING THAT ARE VERY CLEARLY DEAD, I.E. ANY HEXTECH THING EVER)

Kai'Sa doesn't deliver on the fantasy that Venom, DOES deliver

Kai'Sa is (by Riot's own words) supposed to be someone who spent "all" of her life in the void and barely escaped with their life so she's taking a refreshing break in the outside, non-murderous world

Do you seriously think that Kai'Sa delivers on the character aspect of "person who barely survived in hellhole and barely escaped and is taking a refreshing break?"

Kai'Sa delivers on TWO pieces of her character. That she's got superpowers from the void, and that she is Kassadin's daughter

The rest of her character takes a huge backseat, so much so that the suit she has from the void(that you claim will "consume her if she doesn't feed it") isn't shown to have **_ANY SORT OF INTELLIGENCE_**

The suit doesn't grumble, shriek, make noise, or even change colors reactively(like camouflage)

If the Suit that Kai'Sa wears did ANY of that, your "Iron man suit" analogy would work

it's BECAUSE the suit of Kai'Sa doesn't show any intelligence that we know IT WILL NEVER KILL HER

it's BECAUSE the suit of Kai'Sa doesn't do anything besides "be worn" by Kai'Sa that we can figure out it's purely a fake-story built by Riot just so they could fill in the story for a champ they designed WITHOUT A STORY AND WITH A KIT FIRST

Riot didn't deliver on their OWN STANDARDS of what a champ is supposed to be, story-wise, gameplay-wise, and lore-wise

Venom delivers on NEARLY EVERY STANDARD PEOPLE WOULD HAVE FROM A MARVEL MOVIE. It's a unique interpretation, it's within Venom's character to do what we see in the trailer, Venom hasn't inherently changed from what the concept was, and Venom is made with a PURPOSE in mind. To be an antithesis to Spiderman

Are you daft?

>MMMHMMM And Kai'Sa's "suit" is SHOWN to have it's own arsenal of weapons that evolved specifically to being more efficient at killing other Voidborn HOW?

Her gameplay? Her splash? Those aren't her weapons. Those Void crystals she summons as her weapons allow her to focus the Void energy into a single point. Those are makeshift weapons, likely of her design. Evolution points based on stats she's collected and every other Voidborn that exists in the game already? Kha'Zix's evolutions, Cho's growth spurts after eating minions/champions with R, Kog's hybrid damage dealing, Vel'Koz's true damage dealing after he analyzed his target's weaknesses?

It's like you're not even trying at this point to give me a good argument.
You're just regurgitating what was superficially said once and i can shoot every one of these points down because they're not true and come from the place of ignorance that should've been taken care of already - if you read her lore.

>Kai'Sa is (by Riot's own words) supposed to be someone who spent "all" of her life in the void and barely escaped with their life so she's taking a refreshing break in the outside, non-murderous world

Nope. They didn't say that.
How can you paraphrase a wrong point of the original comment? Kaisa fell in with her entire village when she was young and she found a way back into the desert in her late teens. If that's her "whole life", then she doesn't have much more time to live, does she?

>The suit isn't shown to have ANY form of intelligence. NONE. ZERO. ZILCH

I might've expressed myself wrong at first but the "suit" looks like to be an instinctual being. However, any Voidborn we have in the game clearly shows that they're intelligent and can talk to you. The problem is whether we can understand it. Rek'Sai might be an exception or she can talk but not in any language we know. Vel'Koz is a highly intelligent Voidborn that's has his focus set on acquiring the knowledge from various dimensions. He'll even kill his own to stop them from mindlessly interfering in his analysis of data.

Not every Voidborn is intelligent.
There may be certain tiers where further evolution gives them an ability to think for themselves instead relying on instinct to survive. However, that might be the entire point. If you're constantly at the top of the food chain in the Void, you get to evolve at a much faster pace. So the intelligent Voidborn might've had to evolve from the lower-life Voidborn.

>"She's more or less forced to feed it in order to keep it under control"
>So why isn't this shown somehow?

It is, in her comic.
And in her VO. You don't really seem like you read anything about (or played) Kai'Sa to know this difference.

>Kai'Sa doesn't deliver on the fantasy that Venom, DOES deliver

Kai'Sa doesn't have any similarities to Venom.
Kayn does, as i've already explained. Venom's and Eddie's story is one about posession. Kayn fits this bill much more than Kai'Sa. Kai'Sa's thematic is completely different. The moment you drew a similarity between Kai'Sa and Venom based on weak evidence that both of the stories include a symbiotic being attaching themselves to a human host, is your big mistake.

>it's BECAUSE the suit of Kai'Sa doesn't show any intelligence that we know IT WILL NEVER KILL HER

What kind of an argument is this?
It's like you don't even know basic biology.
"It won't kill her because it can't think for itself". _**Just. WOW.**_
As if the only requirement to harming or killing someone is a _**good reason**_ to do it...

Do you know what INSTINCT is? EVERY organism has instinct to ensure its survival.
In the Void, it is kill or be killed. Which means you're the predator or the prey.
Animals don't think about why they're killing each other, they do it in order to feed themselves.

Yeah Venom is pretty much the most iconic symbiote at least in NA. But u gotta keep in mind that they wanted to stay away from "the 2 in one" theme since they just did Kayn recently. Additionally they do like to put their own spin on things. Only this time they may have spun a bit too far out the the theme's general region. Some interactions or more quotes towards the suit would helped as would the suit having more independent motions.

The thing that makes it hard to convey the theme of the symbiot is that the Voidling is basically a vegetable, and she has almost full control over it, except for it needing to eat... so that makes the options for what the suit can do to show that it is in a symbiotic relationship pretty narrow.

Thats kinda the catch 22 with Kai'sa and its unfortunate.

Riot could have made the suit flash different colors based on Kai'Sa health(high purple, moderate blue, low red)

Riot could have made the suit move in noticeable fashions on it's own(which would have solved the "Kai'Sa looks like a cosplayer" issue)

Riot could have had the suit Spit out debris every once-in-a-while in order to show that it's excreting(yes, void poop. But it'd still show that the suit is alive and it's own being)

Riot could have done about 27 different things in order to distinguish the suit from Kayn AND give Kai'Sa her own identity in the process. Instead Riot went with the bare minimum of what the potential of Kai'Sa is

If ANY other major-game studio(FK it even movie studio) had a story/character like the one of Kai'Sa, they would find EVERY SINGLE creative avenue, traverse it, and make sure that audiences will be SATISFIED 200% with the direction they took

There are so few people satisfied with what Kai'Sa has been made into by Riot simply because Riot didn't take any creative venture

Under certain circumstances, not taking a creative venture to try and explore something can be good(like with a mystery story, an adventure story, or a romance story)

But within the story of Kai'Sa, her gameplay, and her VO... all we have is the bare minimum of what a symbiote character can be which comes off as both Lazy and uncreative

Riot pretty much just dug themselves into a minefield but the minefield is hooked up to set off nukes instead of mines

I think they failed at making a parasite suit story that makes sense. If they created an actual symbiotic relationship it would be better then it being a piece of clothing. There's so many different things that needed to get expanded upon. I feel like they were too afraid to make another character like Kayn so they refused to give the suit an actual drive.

When her helmet is down it exactly this concept dude... i mean, Venom is on a male host, and he is basicly just a testosterone jacked black male body suit when you look at him. 

So Kaisa is a busty female, at least her suit has different parts, the thigh missles, the thrusters, her helmet, the crystal guns... i dont see how your comparing it to Venom and saying his is better...

Eddie Brock has dialogue with the Venom symbiote, and the symbiote in most events can operate independently of the will of Eddie if it wants to. The symbiote is also more organic looking than Kai'Sa's suit, and never at any point in live combat does the symbiote leave a part of it's host uncovered at the risk of losing it's host to an attack.

In terms of an alien life form bonding with  a human, Venom makes sense. It defends Eddie, it completely encases Eddie when in combat, and it displays highly organic appendages that it uses in combat. Kai'sa's suit looks completely inorganic, and the moving parts are strange plates, that again look inorganic. The weapons her suit makes for her are crystal guns? Again, this doesn't make a lot of sense, considering that none of the other Void creatures manifest crystal when using projectiles. It's always something related to their organic nature, such as spikes from their body, or light beams from their eyes.
